items.title: Exercise 1: CEO's Letter to Shareholders
items.text:
Dear Shareholders,

Notwithstanding the significant market volatility encountered this year, our company has maintained its commitment to high standards of corporate governance. 

We have successfully implemented our new ESG strategy, albeit with some minor delays in the initial reporting phase. Whereas our competitors have focused solely on short-term profits, we have prioritized long-term sustainability and transparency. 

Directors have continued to discharge their fiduciary duties diligently, ensuring that every decision aligns with our core strategic objectives. Even so, we recognize that there is still room for improvement in our stakeholder engagement processes.

questions.question: What is the tone of the CEO's letter?
questions.explanation: The use of formal connectors and the focus on governance, fiduciary duties, and ESG indicates a professional tone.

questions.question: Which connector is used to show concession regarding the ESG strategy?
questions.explanation: 'Albeit' is used to concede that there were minor delays while maintaining that the implementation was successful.

items.prompt: Exercise 2: Governance Vocabulary. 'Fiduciary duty' is a legal obligation to:
options: Act in the best interest of the shareholders
Make as much money for yourself as possible
items.explanation: Fiduciary duty is the primary legal responsibility of company directors.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Contrast Connectors. Combine these sentences using 'whereas': 'The North office is highly efficient. The South office is struggling with morale.'
items.modelAnswer: The North office is highly efficient, whereas the South office is struggling with morale.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Concession. Rewrite using 'Notwithstanding': 'In spite of the high costs, the board approved the expansion.'
items.modelAnswer: Notwithstanding the high costs, the board approved the expansion.

items.prompt: Exercise 5: Leadership Chunks. To 'align with strategic objectives' means:
options: To disagree with the company's goals
To ensure that actions support the long-term plans of the organization
To change the goals every week
To ignore the objectives and follow your own plan
items.explanation: Alignment ensures that all parts of the organization are working toward the same goals.
